K.definition: A structure built to span a gap or obstacle
A sloped surface used to move between different levels
A solid piece used for building and constructing structures
A round object that turns to help things move
A toothed wheel that works with others to change motion
A form such as a circle, square, or triangle
A symbol used to count and measure things
A constructed structure used for shelter
A path or line that guides movement, like a train track

1.definition: A tool that makes work easier, such as a lever or pulley
A bar that pivots to lift or move loads
A wheel with a rope that helps lift objects
A simple machine consisting of a wheel attached to a rod
A sloped surface used to raise or lower objects
A line showing numbers in order to help with counting and measuring
A math operation that combines two numbers
A math operation that finds the difference between numbers
A rough calculation or guess of a number
A state of evenness or stability, like a scale in equilibrium

2.definition: A toothed wheel that transmits motion and force
A detailed technical drawing or plan for a construction project
The process of determining size, length, or quantity
A balanced and even arrangement of parts
A system of measurement or a tool for weighing objects
The space between two intersecting lines, measured in degrees
The total distance around the edge of a shape
The amount of space inside a shape
The amount of space an object occupies
A visual representation of data using points or bars

A small-scale representation of a larger structure

A measurement of length, width, or height
An early sample built to test and refine a design
A repeated process used to improve a design

A horizontal structural element designed to support loads

The practice of specifying measurements on technical drawings
Computer-Aided Design software used to create precise engineering models

Using mathematical methods to improve design efficiency
The allowable variation in a physical dimension during manufacturing

Describes a structure designed to support weight

Designing a system in separate, interchangeable components

The branch of mathematics that studies relationships between angles and sides of triangles

Evaluating how materials respond to forces to ensure structural safety
